lines.gurmukhi: jnnI jqn kir jugvY jTr rwKY qw qy ipMf pUrn huie suq jnmq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jananee Jatan Kari Jougavai Jatthar Raakhai , Taa Tay Pind Pooran Hui Sout Janamat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a pregnant woman takes all possible care of herself during her pregnancy and on completion of the period gives birth to a baby boy;

lines.gurmukhi: bhuirE AKwid Kwid sMjm sihq rhY qwhI qy pY pIAq Arogpn pq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Bahuriao Akhaadi Khaadi Sanjam Sahit Rahai , Taahee Tay Pai Peeat Arogapan Pat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Then she observes and controls her eating habits meticulously and rigidly that helps the young child to grow healthy by consuming his mother's milk.

lines.gurmukhi: mlmUqR Dwr ko ibcwr n ibcwrY icq krY pRiqpwl bwlu qaU qn gq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Malamootr Dhaar Ko Bichaar N Bichaarai Chita , Karai Pratipaal Baalu Taoo Tan Gat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The mother cares not about all the filth of the child and brings him up to give him a healthy body.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy ArBku rUp isK hY sMswr miD sRI gur dieAwl kI dieAw kY sn gq hY ]353]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Arabhaku Roop Sikh Hai Sansaar Madhi , Sree Gur Daiaal Kee Daiaa Kai San Gat Hai ?353?

Shabad OS B.translation: So is a disciple (Sikh), like a child in this world who like the mother is blessed by the Guru with Naam Simran that ultimately emancipates him. (353)
